reviews.review: Amazing movie overall, just a little upset about the ending because I hate cliff hangers but they have to leave something for part two.
Some funny parts and a great ending, but there was a LOT of mediocre on the way there.

Its unexpected twists and turns, marketing strategy, electric direction, somber performances, and a villain so emotionally thoughtful it should be enough to overcome its heavy reliance on CGI and poor character development/use on certain scenes.
can't wait for the next one!!!

Thor doesn't have an axe and doesn't have short hair!

Hulk doesn't need a frikin iron man suit!

What's going on here?

Too many fight scenes miss mashed with hardly any plot. 

Never really ended up hating the bad guy and instead hated some of the superhero performances.

Film was long but there was no character building? 

Where was Hulk angry and smashing and instead came across sooky and wimpy!

The only real man was Thanos and the other so called super hero men feminized!

The next one will have them painting their nails!
One of the best MCU and superhero films of all time. The film brilliantly balances all of its characters while giving Thanos a fair amount of character development.
Very mediocre in terms of plot.

Amazing movie! I loved that they changed it up and made the villain, Thanos, the focal point of the story. The Russo brothers did a great job with balancing out all of the hero's screentime. Sure it feels like part one of a two part movie due to most of the deaths at the end not holding up, but it was still an awesome movie.

I am not sure how one can travel through so many universes at one time, but this movie managed to do it. It was an amazing compilation and integration of all the movies that has made Marvel into a phenomenon. My only criticism is that the movie was extremely fast and covered a lot of territory while leaving some thoughts unfinished and characters undeveloped. Though it accomplished an oddessy like non other, it would not hurt to slow it down next time and either lengthen or create two movies out of one episode to allow for juicier development and more impactful scenes.

While I'm not a massive fan of superhero movies, I did enjoy this one and think it should be praised simply for being able to have so many characters without it feeling too messy. Thanos is an effective villain, having feelings and motivations - sort of being the protagonist and the villain at the same time.
